Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/sqrt.c

1/* mpfr_sqrt -- square root of a floating-point number
2
3Copyright 1999-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
27
28#include "invsqrt_limb.h"
29
30/* Put in rp[1]*2^64+rp[0] an approximation of floor(sqrt(2^128*n)),
31 with 2^126 <= n := np[1]*2^64 + np[0] < 2^128. We have:
32 {rp, 2} - 4 <= floor(sqrt(2^128*n)) <= {rp, 2} + 26. */
33static void
34mpfr_sqrt2_approx (mpfr_limb_ptr rp, mpfr_limb_srcptr np)
35{
36 mp_limb_t x, r1, r0, h, l, t;
37
38 __gmpfr_sqrt_limb (r1, h, l, x, np[1]);
39
40 /* now r1 = floor(sqrt(n1)) and h:l = n1^2 - r1^2 with h:l <= 2*r1,
41 thus h <= 1 */
42
43 l += np[0];
44 h += (l < np[0]);
45
46 /* now h <= 2 */
47
48 /* divide by 2 */
49 l = (h << 63) | (l >> 1);
50 h = h >> 1;
51
52 /* now h <= 1 */
53
54 /* now add (2^64+x) * (h*2^64+l) / 2^64 to [r1*2^64, 0] */
55
56 umul_ppmm (r0, t, x, l); /* x * l */
57 r0 += l;
58 r1 += h + (r0 < l); /* now we have added 2^64 * (h*2^64+l) */
59 if (h)
60 {
61 r0 += x;
62 r1 += (r0 < x); /* add x */
63 }
64
65 MPFR_ASSERTD(r1 & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT);
66
67 rp[0] = r0;
68 rp[1] = r1;
69}
70
71/* Special code for prec(r), prec(u) < GMP_NUMB_BITS. We cannot have
72 prec(u) = GMP_NUMB_BITS here, since when the exponent of u is odd,
73 we need to shift u by one bit to the right without losing any bit.
74 Assumes GMP_NUMB_BITS = 64. */
75static int
76mpfr_sqrt1 (mpfr_ptr r, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
77{
78 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_GET_PREC(r);
79 mpfr_prec_t exp_u = MPFR_EXP(u), exp_r, sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
80 mp_limb_t u0, r0, rb, sb, mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
81 mpfr_limb_ptr rp = MPFR_MANT(r);
82
83 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64);
84
85 /* first make the exponent even */
86 u0 = MPFR_MANT(u)[0];
87 if (((unsigned int) exp_u & 1) != 0)
88 {
89 u0 >>= 1;
90 exp_u ++;
91 }
92 MPFR_ASSERTD (((unsigned int) exp_u & 1) == 0);
93 exp_r = exp_u / 2;
94
95 /* then compute an approximation of the integer square root of
96 u0*2^GMP_NUMB_BITS */
97 __gmpfr_sqrt_limb_approx (r0, u0);
98
99 sb = 1; /* when we can round correctly with the approximation, the sticky bit
100 is non-zero */
101
102 /* the exact square root is in [r0, r0 + 7] */
103 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(((r0 + 7) & (mask >> 1)) <= 7))
104 {
105 /* first ensure r0 has its most significant bit set */
106 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(r0 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
107 r0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
108 umul_ppmm (rb, sb, r0, r0);
109 sub_ddmmss (rb, sb, u0, 0, rb, sb);
110 /* for the exact square root, we should have 0 <= rb:sb <= 2*r0 */
111 while (!(rb == 0 || (rb == 1 && sb <= 2 * r0)))
112 {
113 /* subtract 2*r0+1 from rb:sb: subtract r0 before incrementing r0,
114 then r0 after (which is r0+1) */
115 rb -= (sb < r0);
116 sb -= r0;
117 r0 ++;
118 rb -= (sb < r0);
119 sb -= r0;
120 }
121 /* now we should have rb*2^64 + sb <= 2*r0 */
122 MPFR_ASSERTD(rb == 0 || (rb == 1 && sb <= 2 * r0));
123 sb = rb | sb;
124 }
125
126 rb = r0 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
127 sb |= (r0 & mask) ^ rb;
128 rp[0] = r0 & ~mask;
129
130 /* rounding: sb = 0 implies rb = 0, since (rb,sb)=(1,0) is not possible */
131 MPFR_ASSERTD (rb == 0 || sb != 0);
132
133 /* Note: if 1 and 2 are in [emin,emax], no overflow nor underflow
134 is possible */
135 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r > __gmpfr_emax))
136 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
137
138 /* See comments in mpfr_div_1 */
139 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin))
140 {
141 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
142 {
143 if ((exp_r == __gmpfr_emin - 1) && (rp[0] == ~mask) && rb)
144 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
145 if (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (rp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && sb == 0))
146 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
147 }
148 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, 0))
149 {
150 if ((exp_r == __gmpfr_emin - 1) && (rp[0] == ~mask) && (rb | sb))
151 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
152 }
153 return mpfr_underflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
154 }
155
156 rounding:
157 MPFR_EXP (r) = exp_r;
158 if (sb == 0 /* implies rb = 0 */ || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
159 {
160 MPFR_ASSERTD (rb == 0 || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF);
161 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
162 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
163 MPFR_RET (0);
164 }
165 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
166 {
167 /* since sb <> 0, only rb is needed to decide how to round, and the exact
168 middle is not possible */
169 if (rb == 0)
170 goto truncate;
171 else
172 goto add_one_ulp;
173 }
174 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, 0))
175 {
176 truncate:
177 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
178 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
179 MPFR_RET(-1);
180 }
181 else /* round away from zero */
182 {
183 add_one_ulp:
184 rp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
185 if (rp[0] == 0)
186 {
187 rp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
188 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(exp_r + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
189 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
190 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
191 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
192 MPFR_SET_EXP (r, exp_r + 1);
193 }
194 MPFR_RET(1);
195 }
196}
197
198/* Special code for prec(r) = GMP_NUMB_BITS and prec(u) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS. */
199static int
200mpfr_sqrt1n (mpfr_ptr r, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
201{
202 mpfr_prec_t exp_u = MPFR_EXP(u), exp_r;
203 mp_limb_t u0, r0, rb, sb, low;
204 mpfr_limb_ptr rp = MPFR_MANT(r);
205
206 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64);
207 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(r) == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
208 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_PREC(u) <= GMP_NUMB_BITS);
209
210 /* first make the exponent even */
211 u0 = MPFR_MANT(u)[0];
212 if (((unsigned int) exp_u & 1) != 0)
213 {
214 low = u0 << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1);
215 u0 >>= 1;
216 exp_u ++;
217 }
218 else
219 low = 0; /* low part of u0 */
220 MPFR_ASSERTD (((unsigned int) exp_u & 1) == 0);
221 exp_r = exp_u / 2;
222
223 /* then compute an approximation of the integer square root of
224 u0*2^GMP_NUMB_BITS */
225 __gmpfr_sqrt_limb_approx (r0, u0);
226
227 /* the exact square root is in [r0, r0 + 7] */
228
229 /* first ensure r0 has its most significant bit set */
230 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(r0 < MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT))
231 r0 = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
232
233 umul_ppmm (rb, sb, r0, r0);
234 sub_ddmmss (rb, sb, u0, low, rb, sb);
235 /* for the exact square root, we should have 0 <= rb:sb <= 2*r0 */
236 while (!(rb == 0 || (rb == 1 && sb <= 2 * r0)))
237 {
238 /* subtract 2*r0+1 from rb:sb: subtract r0 before incrementing r0,
239 then r0 after (which is r0+1) */
240 rb -= (sb < r0);
241 sb -= r0;
242 r0 ++;
243 rb -= (sb < r0);
244 sb -= r0;
245 }
246 /* now we have u0*2^64+low = r0^2 + rb*2^64+sb, with rb*2^64+sb <= 2*r0 */
247 MPFR_ASSERTD(rb == 0 || (rb == 1 && sb <= 2 * r0));
248
249 /* We can't have the middle case u0*2^64 = (r0 + 1/2)^2 since
250 (r0 + 1/2)^2 is not an integer.
251 We thus rb = 1 whenever u0*2^64 > (r0 + 1/2)^2, thus rb*2^64 + sb > r0
252 and the sticky bit is always 1, unless we had rb = sb = 0. */
253
254 rb = rb || (sb > r0);
255 sb = rb | sb;
256 rp[0] = r0;
257
258 /* rounding */
259
260 /* Note: if 1 and 2 are in [emin,emax], no overflow nor underflow
261 is possible */
262 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r > __gmpfr_emax))
263 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
264
265 /* See comments in mpfr_div_1 */
266 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin))
267 {
268 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
269 {
270 /* the case rp[0] = 111...111 and rb = 1 cannot happen, since it
271 would imply u0 >= (2^64-1/2)^2/2^64 thus u0 >= 2^64 */
272 if (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (rp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && sb == 0))
273 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
274 }
275 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, 0))
276 {
277 if ((exp_r == __gmpfr_emin - 1) && (rp[0] == ~MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) && (rb | sb))
278 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
279 }
280 return mpfr_underflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
281 }
282
283 /* sb = 0 can only occur when the square root is exact, i.e., rb = 0 */
284
285 rounding:
286 MPFR_EXP (r) = exp_r;
287 if (sb == 0 /* implies rb = 0 */ || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
288 {
289 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
290 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
291 MPFR_RET (0);
292 }
293 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
294 {
295 /* we can't have sb = 0, thus rb is enough */
296 if (rb == 0)
297 goto truncate;
298 else
299 goto add_one_ulp;
300 }
301 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, 0))
302 {
303 truncate:
304 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
305 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
306 MPFR_RET(-1);
307 }
308 else /* round away from zero */
309 {
310 add_one_ulp:
311 rp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE;
312 if (rp[0] == 0)
313 {
314 rp[0] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
315 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(exp_r + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
316 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
317 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
318 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
319 MPFR_SET_EXP (r, exp_r + 1);
320 }
321 MPFR_RET(1);
322 }
323}
324
325/* Special code for GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(r) < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS,
326 and GMP_NUMB_BITS < prec(u) <= 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS.
327 Assumes GMP_NUMB_BITS=64. */
328static int
329mpfr_sqrt2 (mpfr_ptr r, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
330{
331 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_GET_PREC(r);
332 mpfr_limb_ptr up = MPFR_MANT(u), rp = MPFR_MANT(r);
333 mp_limb_t np[4], rb, sb, mask;
334 mpfr_prec_t exp_u = MPFR_EXP(u), exp_r, sh = 2 * GMP_NUMB_BITS - p;
335
336 MPFR_STAT_STATIC_ASSERT (GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64);
337
338 if (((unsigned int) exp_u & 1) != 0)
339 {
340 np[3] = up[1] >> 1;
341 np[2] = (up[1] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (up[0] >> 1);
342 np[1] = up[0] << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1);
343 exp_u ++;
344 }
345 else
346 {
347 np[3] = up[1];
348 np[2] = up[0];
349 np[1] = 0;
350 }
351 exp_r = exp_u / 2;
352
353 mask = MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh);
354
355 mpfr_sqrt2_approx (rp, np + 2);
356 /* with n = np[3]*2^64+np[2], we have:
357 {rp, 2} - 4 <= floor(sqrt(2^128*n)) <= {rp, 2} + 26, thus we can round
358 correctly except when the number formed by the last sh-1 bits
359 of rp[0] is in the range [-26, 4]. */
360 if (MPFR_LIKELY(((rp[0] + 26) & (mask >> 1)) > 30))
361 sb = 1;
362 else
363 {
364 mp_limb_t tp[4], h, l;
365
366 np[0] = 0;
367 mpn_sqr (tp, rp, 2);
368 /* since we know s - 26 <= r <= s + 4 and 0 <= n^2 - s <= 2*s, we have
369 -8*s-16 <= n - r^2 <= 54*s - 676, thus it suffices to compute
370 n - r^2 modulo 2^192 */
371 mpn_sub_n (tp, np, tp, 3);
372 /* invariant: h:l = 2 * {rp, 2}, with upper bit implicit */
373 h = (rp[1] << 1) | (rp[0] >> (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1));
374 l = rp[0] << 1;
375 while ((mp_limb_signed_t) tp[2] < 0) /* approximation was too large */
376 {
377 /* subtract 1 to {rp, 2}, thus 2 to h:l */
378 h -= (l <= MPFR_LIMB_ONE);
379 l -= 2;
380 /* add (1:h:l)+1 to {tp,3} */
381 tp[0] += l + 1;
382 tp[1] += h + (tp[0] < l);
383 /* necessarily rp[1] has its most significant bit set */
384 tp[2] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE + (tp[1] < h || (tp[1] == h && tp[0] < l));
385 }
386 /* now tp[2] >= 0 */
387 /* now we want {tp, 4} <= 2 * {rp, 2}, which implies tp[2] <= 1 */
388 while (tp[2] > 1 || (tp[2] == 1 && tp[1] > h) ||
389 (tp[2] == 1 && tp[1] == h && tp[0] > l))
390 {
391 /* subtract (1:h:l)+1 from {tp,3} */
392 tp[2] -= MPFR_LIMB_ONE + (tp[1] < h || (tp[1] == h && tp[0] <= l));
393 tp[1] -= h + (tp[0] <= l);
394 tp[0] -= l + 1;
395 /* add 2 to h:l */
396 l += 2;
397 h += (l <= MPFR_LIMB_ONE);
398 }
399 /* restore {rp, 2} from h:l */
400 rp[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT | (h >> 1);
401 rp[0] = (h << (GMP_NUMB_BITS - 1)) | (l >> 1);
402 sb = tp[2] | tp[0] | tp[1];
403 }
404
405 rb = rp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1));
406 sb |= (rp[0] & mask) ^ rb;
407 rp[0] = rp[0] & ~mask;
408
409 /* rounding */
410 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r > __gmpfr_emax))
411 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
412
413 /* See comments in mpfr_div_1 */
414 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin))
415 {
416 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
417 {
418 if (exp_r == __gmpfr_emin - 1 && (rp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX &&
419 rp[0] == ~mask) && rb)
420 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
421 if (exp_r < __gmpfr_emin - 1 || (rp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT &&
422 rp[0] == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && sb == 0))
423 rnd_mode = MPFR_RNDZ;
424 }
425 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDA(rnd_mode, 0))
426 {
427 if (exp_r == __gmpfr_emin - 1 && (rp[1] == MPFR_LIMB_MAX &&
428 rp[0] == ~mask) && (rb | sb))
429 goto rounding; /* no underflow */
430 }
431 return mpfr_underflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
432 }
433
434 rounding:
435 MPFR_EXP (r) = exp_r;
436 if (sb == 0 /* implies rb = 0 */ || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDF)
437 {
438 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
439 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
440 MPFR_RET (0);
441 }
442 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
443 {
444 /* since sb <> 0 now, only rb is needed */
445 if (rb == 0)
446 goto truncate;
447 else
448 goto add_one_ulp;
449 }
450 else if (MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDZ(rnd_mode, 0))
451 {
452 truncate:
453 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r >= __gmpfr_emin);
454 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r <= __gmpfr_emax);
455 MPFR_RET(-1);
456 }
457 else /* round away from zero */
458 {
459 add_one_ulp:
460 rp[0] += MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh;
461 rp[1] += rp[0] == 0;
462 if (rp[1] == 0)
463 {
464 rp[1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
465 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(exp_r + 1 > __gmpfr_emax))
466 return mpfr_overflow (r, rnd_mode, 1);
467 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 <= __gmpfr_emax);
468 MPFR_ASSERTD(exp_r + 1 >= __gmpfr_emin);
469 MPFR_SET_EXP (r, exp_r + 1);
470 }
471 MPFR_RET(1);
472 }
473}
474
475#endif /* !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64 */
476
477int
478mpfr_sqrt (mpfr_ptr r, mpfr_srcptr u, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
479{
480 mp_size_t rsize; /* number of limbs of r (plus 1 if exact limb multiple) */
481 mp_size_t rrsize;
482 mp_size_t usize; /* number of limbs of u */
483 mp_size_t tsize; /* number of limbs of the sqrtrem remainder */
484 mp_size_t k;
485 mp_size_t l;
486 mpfr_limb_ptr rp, rp0;
487 mpfr_limb_ptr up;
488 mpfr_limb_ptr sp;
489 mp_limb_t sticky0; /* truncated part of input */
490 mp_limb_t sticky1; /* truncated part of rp[0] */
491 mp_limb_t sticky;
492 int odd_exp;
493 int sh; /* number of extra bits in rp[0] */
494 int inexact; /* return ternary flag */
495 mpfr_exp_t expr;
496 mpfr_prec_t rq = MPFR_GET_PREC (r);
497 MPFR_TMP_DECL(marker);
498
499 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
500 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec (u), mpfr_log_prec, u, rnd_mode),
501 ("y[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d",
502 mpfr_get_prec (r), mpfr_log_prec, r, inexact));
503
504 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_IS_SINGULAR(u)))
505 {
506 if (MPFR_IS_NAN(u))
507 {
508 MPFR_SET_NAN(r);
509 MPFR_RET_NAN;
510 }
511 else if (MPFR_IS_ZERO(u))
512 {
513 /* 0+ or 0- */
514 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN(r, u);
515 MPFR_SET_ZERO(r);
516 MPFR_RET(0); /* zero is exact */
517 }
518 else
519 {
520 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_INF(u));
521 /* sqrt(-Inf) = NAN */
522 if (MPFR_IS_NEG(u))
523 {
524 MPFR_SET_NAN(r);
525 MPFR_RET_NAN;
526 }
527 MPFR_SET_POS(r);
528 MPFR_SET_INF(r);
529 MPFR_RET(0);
530 }
531 }
532 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY(MPFR_IS_NEG(u)))
533 {
534 MPFR_SET_NAN(r);
535 MPFR_RET_NAN;
536 }
537 MPFR_SET_POS(r);
538
539#if !defined(MPFR_GENERIC_ABI) && GMP_NUMB_BITS == 64
540 {
541 mpfr_prec_t uq = MPFR_GET_PREC (u);
542
543 if (rq == uq)
544 {
545 if (rq < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
546 return mpfr_sqrt1 (r, u, rnd_mode);
547
548 if (GMP_NUMB_BITS < rq && rq < 2*GMP_NUMB_BITS)
549 return mpfr_sqrt2 (r, u, rnd_mode);
550
551 if (rq == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
552 return mpfr_sqrt1n (r, u, rnd_mode);
553 }
554 }
555#endif
556
557 MPFR_TMP_MARK (marker);
558 MPFR_UNSIGNED_MINUS_MODULO (sh, rq);
559 if (sh == 0 && rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
560 sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS; /* ugly case */
561 rsize = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(r) + (sh == GMP_NUMB_BITS);
562 /* rsize is the number of limbs of r + 1 if exact limb multiple and rounding
563 to nearest, this is the number of wanted limbs for the square root */
564 rrsize = rsize + rsize;
565 usize = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(u); /* number of limbs of u */
566 rp0 = MPFR_MANT(r);
567 rp = (sh < GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? rp0 : MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (rsize);
568 up = MPFR_MANT(u);
569 sticky0 = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO; /* truncated part of input */
570 sticky1 = MPFR_LIMB_ZERO; /* truncated part of rp[0] */
571 odd_exp = (unsigned int) MPFR_GET_EXP (u) & 1;
572 inexact = -1; /* return ternary flag */
573
574 sp = MPFR_TMP_LIMBS_ALLOC (rrsize);
575
576 /* copy the most significant limbs of u to {sp, rrsize} */
577 if (MPFR_LIKELY(usize <= rrsize)) /* in case r and u have the same precision,
578 we have indeed rrsize = 2 * usize */
579 {
580 k = rrsize - usize;
581 if (MPFR_LIKELY(k))
582 MPN_ZERO (sp, k);
583 if (odd_exp)
584 {
585 if (MPFR_LIKELY(k))
586 sp[k - 1] = mpn_rshift (sp + k, up, usize, 1);
587 else
588 sticky0 = mpn_rshift (sp, up, usize, 1);
589 }
590 else
591 MPN_COPY (sp + rrsize - usize, up, usize);
592 }
593 else /* usize > rrsize: truncate the input */
594 {
595 k = usize - rrsize;
596 if (odd_exp)
597 sticky0 = mpn_rshift (sp, up + k, rrsize, 1);
598 else
599 MPN_COPY (sp, up + k, rrsize);
600 l = k;
601 while (sticky0 == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO && l != 0)
602 sticky0 = up[--l];
603 }
604
605 /* sticky0 is non-zero iff the truncated part of the input is non-zero */
606
607 tsize = mpn_sqrtrem (rp, NULL, sp, rrsize);
608
609 /* a return value of zero in mpn_sqrtrem indicates a perfect square */
610 sticky = sticky0 || tsize != 0;
611
612 /* truncate low bits of rp[0] */
613 sticky1 = rp[0] & ((sh < GMP_NUMB_BITS) ? MPFR_LIMB_MASK(sh)
614 : MPFR_LIMB_MAX);
615 rp[0] -= sticky1;
616
617 sticky = sticky || sticky1;
618
619 expr = (MPFR_GET_EXP(u) + odd_exp) / 2; /* exact */
620
621 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDZ || rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDD || sticky == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO)
622 {
623 inexact = (sticky == MPFR_LIMB_ZERO) ? 0 : -1;
624 goto truncate;
625 }
626 else if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN)
627 {
628 /* if sh < GMP_NUMB_BITS, the round bit is bit (sh-1) of sticky1
629 and the sticky bit is formed by the low sh-1 bits from
630 sticky1, together with the sqrtrem remainder and sticky0. */
631 if (sh < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
632 {
633 if (sticky1 & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1)))
634 { /* round bit is set */
635 if (sticky1 == (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << (sh - 1)) && tsize == 0
636 && sticky0 == 0)
637 goto even_rule;
638 else
639 goto add_one_ulp;
640 }
641 else /* round bit is zero */
642 goto truncate; /* with the default inexact=-1 */
643 }
644 else /* sh = GMP_NUMB_BITS: the round bit is the most significant bit
645 of rp[0], and the remaining GMP_NUMB_BITS-1 bits contribute to
646 the sticky bit */
647 {
648 if (sticky1 & MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT)
649 { /* round bit is set */
650 if (sticky1 == MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT && tsize == 0 && sticky0 == 0)
651 goto even_rule;
652 else
653 goto add_one_ulp;
654 }
655 else /* round bit is zero */
656 goto truncate; /* with the default inexact=-1 */
657 }
658 }
659 else /* rnd_mode=GMP_RDNU, necessarily sticky <> 0, thus add 1 ulp */
660 goto add_one_ulp;
661
662 even_rule: /* has to set inexact */
663 if (sh < GMP_NUMB_BITS)
664 inexact = (rp[0] & (MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh)) ? 1 : -1;
665 else
666 inexact = (rp[1] & MPFR_LIMB_ONE) ? 1 : -1;
667 if (inexact == -1)
668 goto truncate;
669 /* else go through add_one_ulp */
670
671 add_one_ulp:
672 inexact = 1; /* always here */
673 if (sh == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
674 {
675 rp ++;
676 rsize --;
677 sh = 0;
678 }
679 /* now rsize = MPFR_LIMB_SIZE(r) */
680 if (mpn_add_1 (rp0, rp, rsize, MPFR_LIMB_ONE << sh))
681 {
682 expr ++;
683 rp0[rsize - 1] = MPFR_LIMB_HIGHBIT;
684 }
685 goto end;
686
687 truncate: /* inexact = 0 or -1 */
688 if (sh == GMP_NUMB_BITS)
689 MPN_COPY (rp0, rp + 1, rsize - 1);
690
691 end:
692 /* Do not use MPFR_SET_EXP because the range has not been checked yet. */
693 MPFR_ASSERTN (expr >= MPFR_EMIN_MIN && expr <= MPFR_EMAX_MAX);
694 MPFR_EXP (r) = expr;
695 MPFR_TMP_FREE(marker);
696
697 return mpfr_check_range (r, inexact, rnd_mode);
698}
699
